title: 82x12: Military Retirement Income and Disclosure Exemptions of 5 U.S.C. app. § 202(a)(1)(A)
summary: A retired military officer who is now employed in the executive branch is not required to disclose his military retirement income.  Such retirement income is considered “reduced compensation for reduced current services” and falls within the parenthetical exception in 5 U.S.C. app. § 202(a)(1)(A).
